Cast the covariates

Source: R/cast_covariates.R
cast_covariates.Rd

Cast the covariates for a model run.

prep_cast_covariates is the primary function, which produces the covariates (min, mean, and max temperature; precipitation; and NDVI) required for a model to be cast. Saves the cast data out via save_cast_cov_csv and tidying the data for use within the model (by removing the vestigial columns that are only needed for saving).

prep_cast_covariates(
  main = ".",
  moons = NULL,
  hist_cov = NULL,
  end_moon = NULL,
  lead_time = 12,
  min_lag = 6,
  cast_date = Sys.Date(),
  control_files = files_control(),
  control_climate_dl = climate_dl_control(),
  quiet = TRUE,
  verbose = FALSE,
  arg_checks = TRUE
)

save_cast_cov_csv(
  main = ".",
  moons = NULL,
  end_moon = NULL,
  cast_date = Sys.Date(),
  cast_cov = NULL,
  control_files = files_control(),
  quiet = TRUE,
  verbose = FALSE,
  arg_checks = TRUE
)

Arguments

main

character name of the main directory tree component.
moons

Lunar data data.frame. See prep_moons.
hist_cov

data.frame of historic covariates. See prep_hist_covariates.
end_moon

Forecast origin. integer-conformable newmoon number or NULL, which equates to the most recently included census' newmoon number.
lead_time

integer-conformable number of timesteps forward a cast will proceed.
min_lag

integer-conformable minimum non-0 covariate lag time used in any model.
cast_date

Date on which the cast happens. Generally should be Sys.Date.
control_files

list of names of the folders and files within the sub directories and saving strategies (save, overwrite, append, etc.). Generally shouldn't need to be edited. See files_control.
control_climate_dl

list of specifications for the climate download. Sent to NMME_urls to create the specific URLs. See climate_dl_control.
quiet

logical indicator if progress messages should be quieted.
verbose

logical indicator if detailed messages should be shown.
arg_checks

logical value of if the arguments should be checked using standard protocols via check_args. The default (arg_checks = TRUE) ensures that all inputs are formatted correctly and provides directed error messages if not.
cast_cov

data.frame of cast covariates. See cast_covariates.

Value

prep_cast_covariates: data.frame of the cast covariates after saving, with excess columns removed.

save_cast_cov_csv: cast_cov data.frame exactly as input.

Details

If forecasting from the current newmoon, casts the covariates If casting from a previous newmoon, the historical forecasted weather and NDVI data are retrieved from the file pointed to by filename_cov_casts.

Examples

 # \donttest{
  setup_dir()
  hist_cov <- prep_hist_covariates()
  prep_cast_covariates(hist_cov = hist_cov)
  save_cast_cov_csv(cast_cov = cast_cov)
 # }
